title: Our Lady and St Peter's Church, East Grinstead
text:
Our Lady and St Peter's Church is a <a href="Roman%20Catholic">Roman Catholic</a> <a href="Parish%20church">Parish church</a> in <a href="East%20Grinstead">East Grinstead</a>. It was built from 1897 to 1898 and designed by <a href="Frederick%20Walters">Frederick Walters</a>. It is situated on the <a href="A22%20road">London Road</a> close to where it becomes Station Road, north of <a href="East%20Grinstead%20railway%20station">East Grinstead railway station</a>. It is a <a href="Romanesque%20Revival%20architecture">Romanesque Revival</a> church and a Grade II listed building.
History.
Foundation.
In 1879, a Catholic <a href="Christian%20mission">mission</a> was started in East Grinstead. It came from <a href="Crawley">Crawley</a> and was dedicated to St Edward and St Louis. It was founded by Sir Edward and Lady Gertrude Blount. The mission was centred in the chapel of Imberhorne Manor, the home of the Blounts. Sir Edward Blount came from Shropshire and was the son of <a href="Edward%20Blount%20%28MP%29">Edward Blount</a>, a member of the <a href="House%20of%20Commons%20of%20the%20United%20Kingdom">House of Commons</a> for <a href="Steyning">Steyning</a>. After founding the Blount Père et Fils Bank in 1831 (which merged with <a href="Soci%C3%A9t%C3%A9%20G%C3%A9n%C3%A9rale">Société Générale</a> in 1870), and being <a href="Order%20of%20the%20British%20Empire">knighted</a>, he retired to Sussex.
Construction.
On 15 June 1897, the foundation stone was laid. The architect was <a href="Frederick%20Walters">Frederick Walters</a>. Lady Blount died during construction of the church. On 2 October 1898, the church was opened. In 1899, stained glass windows were installed in the north east chapel. They were made by <a href="Hardman%20%26amp%3B%20Co.">Hardman & Co.</a>, given by the Blounts and dedicated to St Gertrude and St Edward. Most of the fittings in the church was designed by Walters. Also in 1899, the church was consecrated.
Parish.
Our Lady and St Peter's Church's <a href="parish">parish</a> also includes St Bernard's Church on Vicarage Road in <a href="Lingfield%2C%20Surrey">Lingfield, Surrey</a>. It was built in 1956. Formerly in the parish was Our Lady of the Forest Church in <a href="Forest%20Row">Forest Row</a>. It was built in the 1950s, closed in 2009, and was once visited by <a href="John%20F.%20Kennedy">John F. Kennedy</a> on 29 June 1963, during his stay at Harold Macmillan's house at <a href="Birch%20Grove">Birch Grove</a>, part of his only official visit to the UK.
Our Lady and St Peter's Church has two Sunday <a href="Mass%20%28Catholic%20Church%29">Masses</a> at 6.15pm on Saturday and at 10:30am on Sunday. St Bernard's Church has one Sunday Mass at 9:00am. Our Lady and St Peter's Church has its weekdays Masses at 9:30am.
